description: three years after its pilot aired, comedy the other one finally gets a full series and you'll be doubled up with laughter PICK OF THE DAY the other oneBBC1, 9 pm/ BBC1 Wales, 11.25 pm. It starts with a surprise party for Colin, hosted by his wife Tess, played by a scenestealing Rebecca Front, and their tense daughter Catherine, played by The Windsors' Ellie White.
text:
three years after its pilot aired, comedy the other one finally gets a full
series and you'll be doubled up with laughter PICK OF THE DAY the other
oneBBC1, 9pm/ BBC1 Wales, 11.25pm

WHEN this pilot aired in 2017, it was such a hit that critics said it could
have legs for a whole series - and lo and behold, here is that series.

Tonight replays the pilot, which still feels fresh, a reminder of the
brilliant premise and the cracking ensemble cast of four women.

It starts with a surprise party for Colin, hosted by his wife Tess, played by
a scenestealing Rebecca Front, and their tense daughter Catherine, played by
The Windsors' Ellie White.

But Colin drops dead from a heart attack within moments of arriving, and Tess
and Cathy soon discover he had another family living down the road.

Downton's Siobhan Finneran is Colin's 'other wife' Marilyn, a chain smoker who
loathes fresh air and has a mysterious health condition.

She describes Colin as "a sexual shire horse of a man".

Conveniently, Colin called his other daughter Catherine too. But Cat, played
by Lauren Socha, couldn't be more different from her new sister Cathy.

Cathy has a slightly pathetic fiance, played by Amit Shah, works in risk
management, and is "rattling through the seven stages of grief" rather
efficiently.

Meanwhile, Cat works for Deliveroo and has "completed Tinder".

Some polite wrestling over custody of Colin's ashes sets up the plot for this
episode.

"This will be the first time we all know where he is," notes Cat.

A smart, sweet, comedy about what happens when you discover your dead dad has
a secret family, as the women try to make sense of it all.

CAPTION: Marilyn Siobhan Finneran, Cat (Lauren Socha), Cathy (Ellie White) and
Tess (Rebecca Front) are trying to find their way after learning the man in
all their lives was the same one; United in grief at Colin's funeral

title: It's a families affair
html:
three years after its pilot aired, comedy the other one finally gets a full series and you'll be doubled up with laughter PICK OF THE DAY the other oneBBC1, 9pm/ BBC1 Wales, 11.25pm

WHEN this pilot aired in 2017, it was such a hit that critics said it could have legs for a whole series - and lo and behold, here is that series.

Tonight replays the pilot, which still feels fresh, a reminder of the brilliant premise and the cracking ensemble cast of four women.

It starts with a surprise party for Colin, hosted by his wife Tess, played by a scenestealing Rebecca Front, and their tense daughter Catherine, played by The Windsors' Ellie White.

But Colin drops dead from a heart attack within moments of arriving, and Tess and Cathy soon discover he had another family living down the road.

Downton's Siobhan Finneran is Colin's 'other wife' Marilyn, a chain smoker who loathes fresh air and has a mysterious health condition.

She describes Colin as "a sexual shire horse of a man".

Conveniently, Colin called his other daughter Catherine too. But Cat, played by Lauren Socha, couldn't be more different from her new sister Cathy.

Cathy has a slightly pathetic fiancé, played by Amit Shah, works in risk management, and is "rattling through the seven stages of grief" rather efficiently.

Meanwhile, Cat works for Deliveroo and has "completed Tinder".

Some polite wrestling over custody of Colin's ashes sets up the plot for this episode.

"This will be the first time we all know where he is," notes Cat.

A smart, sweet, comedy about what happens when you discover your dead dad has a secret family, as the women try to make sense of it all.

CAPTION: Marilyn Siobhan Finneran, Cat (Lauren Socha), Cathy (Ellie White) and Tess (Rebecca Front) are trying to find their way after learning the man in all their lives was the same one; United in grief at Colin's funeral
